meanings.definition: The original form of data before it is encrypted.
meanings.sent1: I always make sure to keep a copy of the plaintexts before encrypting the data.
meanings.sent2: The hacker was able to access the plaintexts of the sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The spy mistakenly left the plaintexts of the secret message on the table for everyone to see.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the plaintexts is like a clear stream flowing through the digital world.
meanings.sent5: Remember to protect the plaintexts like you would guard a precious treasure.

meanings.definition: Text that is not coded or disguised in any way.
meanings.sent1: The email contained plaintexts of the conversation between the two parties.
meanings.sent2: It is important to secure the plaintexts to prevent unauthorized access.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the plaintexts of the suspect's alibi in a forgotten folder.
meanings.sent4: The plaintexts lay bare the truth behind the encrypted messages.
meanings.sent5: The plaintexts revealed the hidden message like a light shining in the darkness.
